explanation_composer.regulatory_rule_cue:
Traffic Separation Scheme (TSS) - Applicable in structured shipping lanes such as Atlantic Crossing 1 (AC1) Seg.A and adjacent controlled zones; vessels are expected to follow designated routes to avoid collisions.
Operational Protocol Rationale: Cargo vessels operating without hazardous cargo and under steady propulsion typically maintain straight, predictable paths along predefined maritime corridors, especially in regulated waters with established traffic patterns. The observed stable speed, consistent course over ground, and tight alignment between heading and motion direction indicate autopilot-assisted navigation on a fixed route—consistent with standard seafaring practice in open waters near busy shipping lanes. This behavior minimizes navigational risk and ensures compliance with international collision avoidance guidelines. Alternative behaviors involving sharp turns or variable speeds are unlikely given the vessel’s operational state and absence of maneuvering indicators.
